intro: Lepigonum australe, commonly known as the Australian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas. It has hairy leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that attract pollinators like bees and butterflies. Lepigonum australe is a hardy perennial that thrives in full sun and is relatively drought-tolerant.
